ourStory.meta.title: Our story - AeroX
ourStory.meta.description: The story behind AeroX ‚Äî the virtual wind tunnel for cyclists and triathletes. Born from a real training need: optimize your aero on a smart trainer, ride faster, save watts.
ourStory.hero.title: AeroX: from pain point to breakthrough
ourStory.hero.subtitle: A triathlon problem turned into a tool any cyclist can use
ourStory.p1: It started with long hours on a smart trainer. Power up, numbers up‚Ä¶ then race day: climbing, I caught riders; on the flat, I got dropped. The reason? Aerodynamics ‚Äî the invisible drag that‚Äôs ~70 % of resistance at 25 km/h and up to 95 % at high speed.
ourStory.p2: Like many, I thought higher Zwift watts meant real progress. I wasn‚Äôt training my aero position. Outside, I held it for minutes at best. I blamed bikes and wheels‚Ä¶ until my CNRS background reminded me: ~80 % of aero losses come from the rider, not the gear. The real brake was me.
ourStory.p3: Feel can fool you. Pushing harder isn‚Äôt the answer. A raised head or wide aerobars can cost dozens of watts and several km/h. Indoors, nothing forces you to learn or correct your posture. Worse, Zwift tucks your avatar downhill when you stop pedaling ‚Äî misleading. Result: zero feedback. Zero constraints. Zero lasting progress.
ourStory.p4: Out of that frustration came AeroX: an app that turns your smart trainer into a virtual wind tunnel. With just a webcam, you see in real time how position changes affect speed. You save watts and go faster ‚Äî like a pro wind tunnel at ‚Ç¨1800/day ‚Äî but from your living room, for the price of a coffee a day.
ourStory.p5: From the first tests, it was clear: narrower aerobars, head tucked, position held ‚Äî I gained 3 km/h in races. Beyond a personal tool, AeroX lets thousands of cyclists and triathletes learn aero, measure it, feel it, and finally train smart so every watt turns into speed.
ourStory.team.title: The team behind AeroX
ourStory.team.subtitle: Two builders, complementary paths, one mission: democratize aerodynamics
ourStory.team.olivier.desc: Former CNRS researcher and passionate triathlete, Olivier built AeroX to solve his own aero roadblocks. He now brings scientific rigor and athlete insight to riders ‚Äî amateur to elite ‚Äî who want to go faster.
ourStory.team.milan.desc: Elite triathlete, 2nd at the European Junior Cup (2025). Milan represents the new generation. His top-level feedback drives AeroX‚Äôs development so it fits real racing demands ‚Äî even for the most demanding athletes.

ourStory.cta.sub: Be among the first to transform your indoor training with real-time aero analysis.
home.meta.title: AeroX ‚Äî Indoor cycling with real-time aerodynamics
home.meta.description: AeroX turns your smart trainer into a wind tunnel: measure your position with just a webcam, gain 2‚Äì3 km/h and save 40 W. Built for demanding cyclists and triathletes, progress beyond Zwift, MyWhoosh and Kinomap.
home.hero.subtitle: AeroX is the first indoor-cycling app for performance-driven cyclists and triathletes that integrates real-time aerodynamics on a smart trainer. With just a webcam, measure frontal area, optimize position, gain up to 3 km/h and save 40+ watts. A focused, complementary alternative to Zwift, MyWhoosh and Kinomap that turns power into real speed. Your smart trainer becomes a virtual wind tunnel you can use anytime to ride faster without extra effort. Compatible with Wahoo, Elite, Saris, Tacx and more.
home.hero.paragraph:
Gain up to 3 km/h, save 40 W
 ‚Äî with just a webcam.
home.hero.cta.seo: Download AeroX, an indoor-cycling app with aerodynamics

home.testimonials.title: Testimonials
home.testimonials.subtitle: Triathletes, cyclists and coaches ‚Äî they chose AeroX
home.testimonials.subsubtitle: Amateur and elite triathletes, cyclists and coaches explain how they gain speed and save watts with real-time aerodynamics. A practical alternative to Zwift, MyWhoosh and Kinomap.
home.testimonials.items.milan.text: "Incredible that something so simple is this accurate. I save 35 W just with my position. I‚Äôve got more energy for the run."
home.testimonials.items.frederic.text: "In 4 weeks, +1 km/h without forcing. I didn‚Äôt think aero mattered that much at my level. Now I enjoy riding more, even in the wind. Real innovation versus Zwift."
home.testimonials.items.olivier.text: "Former CNRS researcher and triathlete, I built AeroX for myself ‚Äî it gave me +3 km/h in races. Now I want to democratize this feedback once reserved for pros. A simple webcam is enough."
home.testimonials.items.james.text:
"My athletes finally see the impact of their position. With Zwift they controlled power; now I have a real lever for free speed.
Thank you, AeroX."
home.features.title: Why add aerodynamics to your training?
home.features.subtitle: Every watt counts ‚Äî and so does your budget.
home.features.ctaDetails: Only left to become an AeroX pioneer and help build the future of indoor cycling!
home.features.items.gain.title: Gain 1 to 5 km/h with no extra effort
home.features.items.gain.desc: See, in real time, how many km/h your position is costing you. +1 km/h at 25 km/h; up to +5 km/h at 45 km/h. Better than a ‚Ç¨5000 bike.
home.features.items.gain.education:
From 25 km/h, air eats ~70 % of your power (up to 95 % at 45). Shrink frontal area, get speed back. Elbows in, head low, narrow bars ‚Äî AeroX shows the gains as you move.

üëâ Finish rides getting home faster without pushing harder ‚Äî slicing through air. That‚Äôs performance and fun.
home.features.items.gain.aria: Download AeroX, indoor-cycling app to gain 1‚Äì5 km/h with your aerodynamics
home.features.items.real.title: Gain real speed, not virtual power
home.features.items.real.desc: On a trainer you progress in a virtual world. With AeroX, you save 40 W ‚Äî and get faster outside.
home.features.items.real.education: Smart trainers push you to chase power ‚Äî great for virtual fun. Outside, you‚Äôre not always faster, and aero may feel awkward. That‚Äôs 40 W lost. Real-time aero feedback both optimizes your position and turns it into a habit, so you enjoy outdoor rides and perform when it counts.
home.features.items.pro.title: Train like a pro ‚Äî without an elite budget
home.features.items.pro.desc: Pros master power, heart rate‚Ä¶ and aero. A wind tunnel? From ‚Ç¨1500. AeroX brings the same lever to your smart trainer ‚Äî with just a webcam.
home.features.items.pro.education:
Classic plans cover power and HR. But TT champions also hold power in optimal aero. Testing aero is out of reach for 99 % of riders (wind tunnels, velodromes, sensors). AeroX changes that: real-time position data from home training.

üëâ What pros pay thousands for, you can now use at home ‚Äî with that feeling: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm training like them.‚Äù
home.features.items.pro.cta: Train like a pro with AeroX
home.features.items.cost.title: Ride faster without spending thousands
home.features.items.cost.desc: 90 % of aero drag is your position ‚Äî not bike, wheels or helmet. Learn to optimize it for less than aero socks.
home.features.items.cost.education: Deep wheels, high-end frames, fancy helmets‚Ä¶ marketing sells a few watts for thousands of euros. In reality, your body creates most of the drag. The best bike won‚Äôt fix a position you can‚Äôt hold for 5 minutes. Invest where it pays: your position. Your top-end gear deserves top-end training.
home.features.items.proof.title: AeroX really works
home.features.items.proof.desc: I gained +3 km/h ‚Äî from 36 to 39 km/h ‚Äî on a 2008 ‚Ç¨700 bike. No new bike needed.
home.features.items.proof.education: While building AeroX, I learned to hold aero from 25 km/h: narrower aerobars, longer posture, head and shoulders low. Even uphill, once speed passed 25, I stayed aero. Result: 36 ‚Üí 39 km/h on a 2008 ‚Ç¨700 bike, same FTP. I used to get dropped on the flat ‚Äî not anymore. None of it without real-time feedback. ‚Äî Olivier D., triathlete, AeroX founder

home.steps.title: Start training with AeroX in 2 minutes
home.steps.subsubtitle: Easy setup. Works instantly with your smart trainer. Compatible with major brands (Tacx, Garmin, Wahoo, Elite, Saris). As smooth as Zwift, MyWhoosh or Kinomap ‚Äî with one unique advantage: real-time aero to gain speed and save watts.
home.steps.items.1.title: Step 1: Download AeroX
home.steps.items.2.title: Step 2: Place your camera (30 s)
home.steps.items.2.desc: Put your webcam ~1.3 m in front of the trainer. Check in AeroX that you‚Äôre fully visible on the bike ‚Äî that‚Äôs it. Any webcam that connects to your computer works; even your phone over Wi-Fi.
home.steps.items.3.title: Step 3: Calibrate in 2 clicks (10 s)
home.steps.items.3.desc: Click both ends of your handlebar. First time, set bar width and camera distance. Adjust if needed ‚Äî you‚Äôre ready. Settings are saved for next time.
home.steps.items.4.title: Step 4: Connect your smart trainer (20 s)
home.steps.items.4.desc: Bluetooth detection, no complex setup. AeroX finds your trainer and HR strap. Pick devices once; it auto-connects next time. Works with Wahoo, Elite, Tacx, Saris, Kickr, Suito, Zwift, etc. Garmin, Polar, Suunto for HR.
home.steps.items.5.title: Ride!
home.faq.title: Answers to your questions
home.faq.subtitle: Frequently asked questions
home.faq.items.1.title: Why AeroX?
home.faq.items.1.education: From 25 km/h, aerodynamics is 70‚Äì95% of what slows you down. Without data, we just push harder. AeroX shows other, smarter levers. After that, you won‚Äôt be able to say: I didn‚Äôt know.
home.faq.items.2.title: What gear do I need?
home.faq.items.2.education: A smart trainer (Bluetooth FTMS), your bike, a computer (macOS or Windows) and a webcam ‚Äî laptop cam, smartphone or USB webcam.
home.faq.items.2.more: A computer, your smart trainer, a camera
home.faq.items.3.title: How long does setup take?
home.faq.items.3.education: Place the camera, calibrate in two clicks ‚Äî you‚Äôre ready for real-time aero feedback.
home.faq.items.3.more: In under 2 minutes, your trainer becomes a virtual wind tunnel‚Ä¶
home.faq.items.4.title: Is my trainer or sensor compatible with AeroX?
home.faq.items.4.education: Yes. AeroX works with most smart trainers (Wahoo, Elite, Tacx, Saris, etc.). macOS and Windows available now; tablets in development. If your trainer isn‚Äôt interactive, use analysis mode (visual feedback without resistance control).
home.faq.items.4.more: Compatible with 95% of smart trainers ‚Äî probably yours‚Ä¶
home.faq.items.5.title: Innovation or gadget?
home.faq.items.5.education: Built by a CNRS researcher and triathlete, AeroX gives you concrete aero feedback ‚Äî like HR monitors did 20 years ago. Training without HR or power sensors seems unthinkable today. Tomorrow, add aero.
home.faq.items.6.title: I ride in a bunch ‚Äî is this still useful?
home.faq.items.6.education: Cycling isn‚Äôt just sitting in the bunch. Echelons, breakaways, pulling ‚Äî aero makes the difference. With +3 km/h, you might enjoy attacking.
home.faq.items.6.more: Yes ‚Äî unless you plan to stay at the back!
home.faq.items.7.title: Do I need a subscription to find and test my optimal position?
home.faq.items.7.education: You can test on day one, free. The subscription turns that position into a solid habit ‚Äî your sixth sense outdoors.
home.faq.items.7.more: Test with the free plan, progress with a subscription
home.faq.items.8.title: I‚Äôm already used to an aero position ‚Äî is this still useful?
home.faq.items.8.education: Being ‚Äúin position‚Äù isn‚Äôt enough. Effectiveness matters. AeroX makes invisible details visible: head too high, elbows too wide‚Ä¶ fix them with instant feedback.

book.meta.title: The scientific guide to cycling aerodynamics
book.meta.description: Understand the power-speed relationship and structure effective aerodynamic training.
book.hero.title.l2: ride at the speed you deserve.
book.hero.text:
This guide redefines cycling performance by placing aerodynamics at the core of training.

A scientific approach to measure and optimize the real impact of your position on speed.
book.hero.cta: Start riding at the speed you deserve
book.gain.title: An optimal aerodynamic position
book.gain.desc:
Can save up to 45 minutes on an Ironman, increase sprint speed by up to 6 km/h, or save more than 50 W at constant speed.
Without changing equipment.
book.vision.title: Our vision
book.vision.desc: Aerodynamics is a major performance lever in cycling.
book.target.title: Who this method is for
book.target.good.title: For those who refuse to optimize randomly
book.target.good.desc: Athletes, coaches and bike fitters who know position has a decisive impact on performance.
book.target.bad.title: This guide is not for you
book.target.bad.desc: If you believe performance only comes from producing more watts or changing equipment.
book.errors.e1.title: Myth #1
book.errors.e2.title: Myth #2
book.errors.e2.desc: You need new equipment to go faster.
book.errors.e3.title: Myth #3
book.errors.e3.desc: To go faster, you just need more power.
book.method.title: Training aerodynamics
book.method.p1.title: Break common myths
book.method.p1.desc: Aerodynamics would only matter above 35 km/h or be only about equipment. Physics shows otherwise.
book.method.p2.title: Optimize your speed
book.method.p2.desc: Improving performance means optimizing speed, not just power.
book.method.p3.title: Measure to structure
book.method.p3.desc: Evaluating aerodynamic efficiency is the foundation for riding faster without more effort.
book.method.p4.title: Gain real speed
book.method.p4.desc: An optimal position can reduce aerodynamic drag by up to 30%.
book.concrete.title: What this method will change in the way you perform
book.concrete.p1.title: Understand why your sensations already make you lose precious minutes
book.concrete.p2.title: Assess how much time you can gain with an optimized position
book.concrete.p3.title: Discover the 3 pillars of true aerodynamic skill
book.concrete.p4.title: Structure your training to master your aerodynamics
book.concrete.p5.title: Experience a new feeling of speed and fluidity you‚Äôve never known before
book.content.title: What you will actually get in the guide
book.content.p2: Physical principles explained simply to understand aerodynamics
book.content.p3: Analysis of 4 real performances based on true aerodynamic mastery
book.content.p4: A method to estimate your real gains in speed, time and watts
book.content.p5: A practical framework to train your aerodynamic position effectively
book.philo.title: Our philosophy
book.philo.desc: Training decisions should rely on science, not beliefs.
book.cta.question: How many minutes could you gain with your current level?
